questions.question: Which of the following objects will have the greatest change in motion?

choices.answer: A small force with a large mass.
A small force with a small mass
A large force with a large mass.
A large force with a small mass.

choices.answer: A force of attraction between two objects.
Objects that are equal in size.

questions.question: What is an example of gravity?

choices.answer: Throwing a ball in the air and it never comes back down.
Petals falling from a flower to the ground.
Jumping on a trampoline and not coming back down.
Kicking a football in the air that never comes back down.

questions.question: Balanced forces are...

choices.answer: a change in speed or direction.
equal in size but opposite in direction.

choices.answer: by changing data that does not fit.

questions.question: Which of the following would occur as a result of unbalanced forces?

choices.answer: A satellite orbits Earth at a constant speed.
Twelve children lean their shoulders against a single wall.
A bus moves along a highway in a straight line at 65 mph.
Tug of war teams move back and forth in opposite directions.
